item.title: Battlefield 6's Game Pass Situation is a Bummer, But It Might Not Be a Complete Loss
item.description:
A huge number of players are gearing up to finally experience Battlefield 6 over the coming weeks, with the title's hotly-anticipated beta being slated to launch over the coming days. This will put a massive amount of attention on the game, with many understandably seeing the project as the best opportunity that the Battlefield franchise has had in some time in terms of stamping its mark on the industry once again.

As expected, a lot of questions are subsequently being asked in relation to Battlefield 6 's availability, with the game perhaps rightly choosing to avoid launching on last-generation consoles. Many fans have also been wondering whether Battlefield 6 will be available through the popular Xbox Game Pass service, though it was recently clarified that this will not be the case. The absence of Battlefield 6 from Game Pass makes sense for many reasons, though there will likely still be some Game Pass-related benefits that fans should not miss out on thanks to EA Play.

Xbox Game Pass Was Never Going to Include Battlefield 6, Though There is a Silver Lining

The introduction of Xbox Game Pass has proven to be quite a popular business move on Microsoft's part, with the subscription service being expected to currently have over 35 million users. This high subscriber count is only growing thanks to some big-name titles recently coming to Xbox Game Pass as day-one additions, with Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 famously making waves this way last year.

Of course, these titles are usually directly tied to Microsoft's aggressive approach to studio acquisitions, meaning many huge releases will slip through the cracks in terms of Game Pass availability. Call of Duty 's direct involvement with Xbox Game Pass is tied to Microsoft's record-breaking $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard, with Call of Duty standing as the largest direct competitor to Battlefield .

The rivalry between Battlefield and CoD has been ongoing for many years, with a lot of players pipping Battlefield 6 as a huge chance for the DICE franchise to land a strong blow on the Activision IP. The upcoming launch of Black Ops 7 is already facing some criticism as the second consecutive Black Ops title for Call of Duty , and Microsoft will not want to boost Battlefield 6 's availability and potential success even further through Xbox Game Pass. Despite this, Xbox Game Pass Ultimate and PC Game Pass subscriptions come with EA Play, potentially offering Game Pass players a trial run of Battlefield 6 when the game launches.

EA Play Could Be the Key to Giving Xbox Game Pass Subscribers Some Battlefield 6 Benefits

The most basic tier of the EA Play subscription service is included in the Ultimate and PC Game Pass tiers at no extra cost, leading to a wider selection of games as well as trials of titles tied to EA. It is possible that Battlefield 6 will feature its own EA Play 10-hour trial through these Game Pass subscription tiers, with players having brief full access to the game. If this is the case, then any game progress garnered through the trial could be carried over with a full purchase, with EA Play also offering discounts on many full-game purchases.

Battlefield 6 will be fully available through the EA Play Pro subscription tier, though this is a PC-only service that is not bundled with any Game Pass tiers.

This could be an excellent way for some Xbox Game Pass subscribers to get a comprehensive feel of what Battlefield 6 offers, being quite useful for players who are currently on the fence regarding the upcoming game. The amount of hype surrounding Battlefield 6 is hard to ignore, and while it makes sense that the game will not be coming to Xbox Game Pass, EA Play might still provide millions of subscribers with a lengthy trial of the title. With this potentially also extending to discounts, there might be some real benefit between Xbox Game Pass and Battlefield 6 after all.

item.title: Tales of the Shire Continues an Underrated Cozy Game Tradition
item.description:
The cozy game genre has been around for almost 30 years, and during its lifetime it's developed a plethora of traditions and conventions that have now become staple features of the genre. Decorating mechanics, social systems, and a suite of relaxing minigames are all expected elements of a modern cozy game, and Tales of the Shire embraces each one wholeheartedly.

The entirety of Tales of the Shire 's gameplay loop revolves around the usual cozy game formula of increasing friendships with local villagers, performing a variety of tasks for them, and being rewarded with unique items of furniture that players can then use to customize their home. But that's just scratching the surface of Tales of the Shire 's affinity for cozy game traditions. Tales of the Shire also embraces some more underrated cozy genre staples, with its approach to PlayStation trophies being one.

Tales of the Shire's Trophy List Follows Cozy Genre Conventions

Though it isn't true for all genre entries, many cozy games have a fairly straightforward Platinum Trophy hunt for those playing on PlayStation. A Short Hike , for instance, has a 3/10 difficulty rating on PSNProfiles, and the Platinum can be obtained in just four hours. Untitled Goose Game has similar stats, with the same site giving it a 4/10 difficulty rating and stating the Platinum can be earned in just six hours.

Of course, these two examples come from games that are inherently shorter, so it's only natural that their Platinum Trophy hunts are short as well. But even a game like Spiritfarer , which takes around 25 hours to beat (according to HowLongToBeat.com) boasts a pleasant 4/10 difficulty rating on PSNProfiles, and can be completed in its entirety after just one 35-hour playthrough.

What makes the journey to Platinum these cozy games so enjoyable is the nature of their trophies. It's very rare for a cozy game to feature a trophy list that's filled with grind-heavy milestones, and the ones that do appear can often be completed as part of the game's main story content.

Stardew Valley is a noteworthy exception to this cozy game rule, with PSNProfiles listing it at a 6/10 difficulty, and stating it takes 110 hours to Platinum.

Tales of the Shire follows this covert cozy game tradition, delivering a trophy list that shouldn't cause too much friction. Though PSNProfiles doesn't have any stats regarding Tales of the Shire 's trophy list at the time of writing, the vast majority of trophies are fairly easy to complete, and the ones that require a bit of a grind shouldn't take up too much of the player's time.

The Most Difficult Trophies to Get in Tales of the Shire

Players will likely obtain most of Tales of the Shire 's trophies during the game's main story quest, with it requiring them to engage in all parts of the life-sim's gameplay loop. That said, there are a handful of trophies in Tales of the Shire that might require more attention, such as:

  • "Po-ta-toes" - Cook all recipes containing potatoes
  • "A Charming and Cheerful Garden" - Unlock all garden areas
  • "It Snowed Food and Rained Drink" - Cook one of every meal
  • "Welcome Such Folks as Friends" - Reach maximum Fellowship level with all NPCs
  • "Taking Pleasure in Every Meal" - Satisfy every NPC's craving with a 5-star meal

These trophies are likely going to take most players quite a bit of time to obtain, but the journey for each one shouldn't be too arduous or obtuse.

item.title: One Leaked Pokemon GO Addition Will Be a Must-Have For Every Battle
item.description:
Pokemon GO has bombarded players with tons of events this summer. Not only did the mobile game celebrate its 9th anniversary this past July, but events like the Water Festival kept the Pokedex expanding with new critters, and now Dynamax's time in the limelight is about to end with the Max Finale event featuring Eternatus. The event plans to end the focus on the mechanic with a bang as every Gigantamax Pokemon, along with Zamazenta and Zacian, will be available to catch for a limited time as part of it. There's not much more fans of the Galar region could ask for.

Just like how Pokemon GO kept Mega Evolution around past Generation 7, Dynamax certainly won't be going anywhere even after Max Finale ends. Players can look forward to the large roster of Dynamax Pokemon growing in frequent updates at the very least. It begs the question as to what will be the focus of the next several seasons to come, though. It seems that a leak suggests that Paldea is next with Ogerpon in tow, to the delight of all of her fans.

Why Ogerpon is Going to Be Important For Battles in Pokemon GO

Ogerpon Was Found Within Update Data for Pokemon GO

With plenty of mobile games, dataminers typically find new features in update data, and Pokemon GO is no exception. One group has claimed that a list of Paldea Pokemon might serve as a hint to which critters will be added to the game soon. Not only were there a number of Paradox Pokemon found on the list, but so were a number of prominent Legendaries like Terapagos and Ogerpon. Ogerpon is a force to be reckoned with in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet despite her cute appearance, and this likely won't change much in Pokemon GO . Players can find a list of Ogerpon's stats below.

  • HP: 80
  • Attack: 120
  • Defense: 84
  • Special Attack: 60
  • Special Defense: 96
  • Speed: 110

Ogerpon's stats will need to be adapted to suit Pokemon GO 's more simplified version, but there's strong evidence to suggest that she'll keep her strong Attack while sporting a decent Stamina and Defense on top of it. Everything else will depend on her Fast Attacks.

One reason Ogerpon is such a special creature is her unique mask mechanic, where a simple mask can change her type between Grass, Water, Fire, and Rock. On top of that, the mask takes a dramatic change whenever Ogerpon Terastallizes, which might come sooner rather than later to Pokemon GO if the rest of the leak is to be believed. After all, Terapagos is part of the same leak Ogerpon was found in, and Terapagos isn't much without its Tera and Stellar forms. The only catch is that Pokemon GO leaks don't necessarily confirm what's coming next to the game, as these creatures and any other discovered features could be included in the data for many developmental reasons.

Good stats and an interesting and flexible mechanic aren't the only reasons why Ogerpon's potential arrival in Pokemon GO in the near future is important. After The Teal Mask DLC, many fans became endeared to the Mask Pokemon after hearing about the history of Ogerpon and her masks. As a result, many players will want to catch her, which means raids with her will be well-populated for at least a short while. If her stats are just as desirable as they are in Scarlet and Violet , then fans should get used to seeing her in gyms and other prominent battles for the foreseeable future.

If the recent Pokemon leaks are anything to go by, then if these Paldea critters are truly coming to Pokemon GO soon, it may be as a final farewell to Generation 9 before Generation 10 kicks off potentially next year. Of course, not every leak is credible, so fans should hope for the best while keeping their eyes on the official channels for proper announcements when the time is right.

item.title: Starfield Releases New Update for August 2025
item.description:
A new Starfield update is now available for all players, bringing some improvements and bug fixes to the space exploration title. Bethesda has continued to support Starfield since its launch in late 2023, and while many players remain frustrated by the scarcity of fresh content in the RPG, there is still hope in the community that the rumored next expansion will be a turning point for the troubled game.

While Starfield has been applauded for its setting and soundtrack, its story and exploration have failed to hit the mark with many players. The game's first expansion, Shattered Space, was released just over a year after the title launched and failed to meet expectations, with players left frustrated by rampant bugs and a lack of notable new weapons or gadgets. While the next DLC has not yet been confirmed by the studio, rumors have continued to swirl regarding its existence, with a recent leak indicating that the second Starfield expansion has been pushed out of 2025. This is an unfortunate sign, as player engagement has sunk on Steam, hovering at around 4,500 concurrent players on average.

As players await new story content, Bethesda has officially released a small new update for the space RPG, bringing improvements to the Creation menu along with several much-needed fixes. While this Starfield update was launched in beta in July, it is now available for all players, with a major fix addressing an issue that could potentially cause Extreme Temperature gear to appear incorrectly. Sorting in the Missions Menu has also been improved, and some general crash and stability fixes have been implemented.

In June, players were left disappointed by the lack of Starfield during the Xbox Games Showcase 2025, with many wondering if the developers had moved on to Fallout 5 and The Elder Scrolls 6 . While many had tempered their expectations, the community still found it strange that the RPG didn't make even a small appearance during the event. The Creation Club has continued to see updates, but new content for the title seems out of reach.

Only days ago, a new report indicated that Starfield 's rumored PS5 port would be released in Spring 2026, alongside the game's second expansion and additional "quality-of-life updates." However, the source stated that this announcement wouldn't be made during this month's Gamescom event, nor will the PS5 port be shadow dropped. A release on Sony's platform may help to bolster Starfield 's dwindling player count, though Bethesda has not yet confirmed its existence.

Starfield Update 1.15.222 Patch Notes (August 5, 2025)

  • Minor improvements to format and display in Creations menus.
  • Addressed an issue that could cause that Extreme Temperature gear to appear incorrectly.
  • Minor improvements to sorting in the Missions Menu.
  • General crash and stability fixes.

item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Activities, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Updated August 5, 2025: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. With Destiny 2 's Arms Week event now at an end for now, Bungie is quickly pivoting to the next big calendar item for players. The annual Solstice event is going live starting today, bringing with it plenty more to do.

As revealed in a previous blog post, Bungie is bringing back the annual Solstice event for Destiny 2 , adding a beach and summer theme to the game. However, unlike previous years, the Bonfire Bash activity won't be returning and instead, the Portal activities will have special solar modifiers to help mix up gameplay. Outside of that, the Event Home will feature new missions to complete and rewards to unlock, with the Eververse store also featuring unique armor cosmetics as well.

In addition, the Destiny 2 weekly reset has returned, bringing with it the usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of August 5, including Portal updates, activity rotations, and weekly challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Nightfall Strikes and The Portal

Nightfall Strikes in The Edge of Fate are now on a daily rotation, including all strikes and Battlegrounds. Legacy rewards are on a knockout list, so players can take on Fireteam, Solo, and Pinnacle ops via the Portal to earn gear they don't yet have on completion. Grandmaster matchmaking is available in the Portal as of August 5.

Players can also find Nightfall weapons with the weekend merchant Xur on occasion as well. Make sure to check our weekly guide to see what Xur has on Friday at reset.
